Claim: "A black and brown dog shakes water off of itself."
Implication: "A black and brown dog is shaking itself dry."
Referring expressions: Black and brown dog, water, itself.  Black and brown dog, itself, dry.
Properties: IsBlackAndBrown(a),  IsShakingWater(a),  IsOnItself(c)  IsBlackAndBrown(a),  IsShakingItself(a),  IsDry(d)
Formula: (exists c (exists a (IsBlackAndBrown(a) and IsShakingWater(a) and IsOnItself(c))) & (forall f (  IsShakingItself(f) ->  IsBlackAndBrown(f))) & (forall g (  IsShakingWater(g) ->  IsBlackAndBrown(g)))) -> (exists a (exists d (IsBlackAndBrown(a) and IsShakingItself(a) and IsDry(d))))
